title: Sugar-Free Chocolate Cake
description: A delicious, easy to bake chocolate cake that's ready in less than 5 hours
creator: baker213
directions: Preheat oven to 175 degrees C. Grease and lightly flour a large baking tray and set aside. Stir together flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside.

In a large mixing bowl, beat the butter or margarine with an electric mixer on medium to high speed for about 30 seconds. Add sugar and beat until the mixture is well combined. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after adding each one. Beat in chocolate and vanilla. Add dry mixture and 1.25 cups of water alternately to beaten mixture, beating on low speed after each addition just until combined. Pour batter onto the baking tray.
Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until a wooden toothpick comes out clean. Cool layer cakes on trays on wire racks for 10 minutes. Remove layer cakes from trays. Cool thoroughly on racks.

comments.author: user163
comments.text: Was easy to make and delicious. Thanks. :)

creator: user163
title: Cheesecake
directions: Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celcius
Mix ingredients together in a bowl
Put in the oven
Take out of the oven after 30 minutes

creator: user163
title: Lasagna
directions: Preheat oven to 180C
Cook mince in a pan until brown
Add alternate layers of mince and pasta to a large ovenproof dish until full
Cook in oven for 25 minutes
Allow to cool for 5 minutes before serving

comments.author: user163
comments.text: Simple and tasty. Just what I needed for my family!

creator: user163
title: Strawberry Cheesecake
description: A quick and simple recipe for a delicious strawberry cheesecake!
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F.

Beat cheese and mayo at medium speed until smooth. Gradually beat in sugar. Beat in eggs one at a time. Beat in vanilla until smooth. Pour into crust, place on a cookie sheet and bake at 350 F for 50 to 55 minutes.
Pour on strawberry sauce topping

creator: newUser164
title: Chicken and Rice Soup
description: An easy variation of a beloved family meal
directions: Place a soup pot over medium heat and add the olive oil.
Add the onion, garlic, carrots, celery, thyme and bay leaf.
Cook and stir for about 6 minutes, until the vegetables are softened but not browned.
Pour in the chicken broth and water- bring the liquid to a boil.
Add in the rice and chicken; season with salt and pepper.
Cook on medium-low until the rice is tender-about 30 minutes.
Serve hot.

creator: newUser164
title: Sliders
directions: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Finely chop onion and parsley. Combine beef, onion, parsley, garlic and salt in a bowl; mix well. Press beef mixture evenly over bottom of a large bar pan. Bake 10-12 minutes or until beef is no longer pink.

Meanwhile, cut cheese into quarters; set aside. Slice buns apart neatly at seams (do not separate tops from bottoms). Trim about 1/4 inch from each bun end to square off ends (discard trimmings). cut buns into thirds for a total of 24 square mini buns, set aside.

Remove bar pan from oven. Pour off juices, if necessary, and place on a cooling rack. Cut beef mixture into 24 squares using a pizza cutter. Top each burger with one pickle and one piece of cheese. Place one bun top onto each burger; top with one bun bottom. Cover bar pan with aluminum foil and bake 3-5 minutes or until cheese is melted and buns are warm.
To serve, place one burger with bun top onto one bun bottom using a mini spatula. Repeat with remaining burgers and bun bottoms. Serve immediately.

creator: chefguy19
title: White Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Just regular chocolate chip cookies, except with white chocolate in them instead of milk chocolate
directions: Heat oven to 190C.

Mix sugars, butter, vanilla and egg in large bowl. Stir in flour, baking soda and salt (dough will be stiff). Stir in chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls about 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until light brown (centers will be soft). Cool slightly; remove from cookie sheet. Cool on wire rack.  (Total time will vary; cook or bake time is per batch.)
